text: Hello Peter, as you know me and GINA have been together for over three years now. She has never asked me for money. She is a very hard working independent woman.  Between her sari sari store and selling beer and soda to other sari sari store with free delivery. We also raise pigs, we have 12 pigs ready to sell for Christmas. Mama pig is having babies on Nov 25th and those pigs will sell at Easter time.  GINA is working about 16 hours a day right now. How I wish I was there to help her. I do send 10,000 pesos every month for our motorcycle, internet, and our bajaj payment. And she has money left over for what ever else. When I first met GINA she only had a very small sari sari store at her house. Her sari sari store is now on the main road. I can retire as soon as air travel is possible. Between both of us we are building a wonderful life together. The good lord has blessed us
author: Mark messick

text: My girlfriend never asked for anything in the first 2 years of chatting online,she has her own house and business and works from home so I suggested that we both rent a condo together last year for the month I stayed there and that was the first time I had sent money to her. This year has been financially hard for her so I have sent her money for food and electricity and water bills, and she always sends me receipts for everything Even though I don‚Äôt ask for them. We are both hoping that the airports reopen so I can come back to herüôè

text: I've known my little Princesa for 2 years now Pre Covid times and we have actually met and spent quality time together..She lives in Mactan and worked at the Airport..Then when COVID hit she lost her job being retrenched..And as any decent man would do..I offered her 10k per month allowance which she flatly refused..then 5k..and she said 2k is enough which I know is BS especially in Mactan..So I told he if you dont take the 10k..I'm going to divorce youü§£ü§£Her smart arse answer was I dont take money from poor  men because they dont have enough for themselves but in your case I will because you wont find another filipina like me who refuses her white mans money..so I'm a very special catch for youü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

text: I am sending $600. US, or roughly 30,000 pesos per month to my fianc√© that I met personally, and spent time with in the Philippines. I know that sounds like a lot, but she lives in the city where things cost more. She has two children that I chose on my own to enroll them with a private tutor. The tutor is about 10,000 pesos per month, covering both kids. ( That's cheap for the amount of education there getting!).  When the children arrive here soon to the US they won't flunk school to a lower grade. It will save money in the long run because they will graduate from high school sooner, and be out on their own!  Whilel waiting the final months before her K-1 visa is approved she also has the ability to provide some extra food and entertainment to the very family she will be leaving soon. She thanks me everyday for having this opportunity. üá∫üá∏üòéüë∞üèªüáµüá≠
author: BOWN TOWN

She has a job but the noble idiot in me decides to make her life easier.  I should have done more research.

author: Lovely Shan

text: I was shocked to find out that often, electronics can cost a LOT more in the Philippines.  A new phone or Laptop ... You would think it is the opposite....  that it would be a LOWER cost~ but it's not.  And costs even MORE to ship something to Ph., than you might think, I was shocked....   I did (of course) educate myself in typical wages earned, the cost of milk, food, utilities, pharma & travel costs... etc ...  and yes, I do have experience paying for Phone (data costs $$$ for a Filipina girl)  Xoom is a good & helpful app for that  ...if you spend a lot of time on phone with her, texting or sharing photos etc, it may be typical for a guy to pay for her phone / data too.... as a gentleman might.  You are correct in pointing out that often, men obligate themselves  ...so, once you step over THAT particular threshold within your own mind (emotionally) ... try to be certain it is what you want to do.  IF you do CARE about the Girl, do not forget, she may come to depend upon what you give her.  Then...?  IF giving the money becomes a point of contention? You can mess up your "Good" relationship with your LDR-Filipina  ... what I mean is this.  if you obligate yourself & get into a "Habit" with her..... (and she is entirely comfortable with you & the "giving" situation) do not then TURN AROUND and FREAK OUT ON HER! .... if you (the guy doing the giving) has a problem with the Peso's you supply her....  and if you begin to feel she doesn't appreciate it.  That may not be the case at all  You might INDEED have "achieved" ... making her feel Loved & SECURE......  ... and she is not being ungrateful ... but she Merely, COMPLETELY TOTALLY BELIEVES IN YOU.... And... she believes in your LDR with her, & that you CARE  .... (if she is a good girl)(and often they ARE "good girls")  it is very easy to grow unhappy, with Your Own ROLE as "The Giver" ................ Do Not Blame The Girl ....  often, these ARE "Good Girls" and yes, there are also girls who know how to:  "Work The Men for $$$"  .... they are not all criminals Often, you CAN tell, when a girl is from a province, and directly involved with her family.... and if she pretty much shares all of her life at ANY TIME of the day with you.... after a while?  Yes, you can probably allow yourself to trust her.  I got lucky.  Found a "GOOD" Girl..... she was indeed a Good Girl and a Good Human being I am writing this because even THEN.... it is not EASY to maintain your own mental / emotional stability in a LDR it is demanding sometimes, and can definitely TEST you.  The info you are getting in these video's is quite quite Excellent..... he knows what he's talking about .........
author: AutomationDnD

text: Sending 400$ a month  in a serious relationship nothing.  if she working full time at 260$ a month  city  rent 200 $  lights water gas cooking trike rides etc. God forbid wifi  (school 15 yr old child )  .  Her income may buy food for  mouth that about it. .   If she has  no rent  or living in her province with no job then ya she could live off of 400$ a month for me it started with buying loads  i seen it as dating then i went seen her  fall of 2018 the money thing went  up i see the need . Expats said she can live off this much is not true in most cases depend on where she lives.   The longer your with her  the more she cost especially if she wife material.  What if she wants to  go offshore for work ?  Job she has not worth it or she can't find a job ?  Or  do you say no i will take care of you?  i see that a lot Philippines guys move there or LDR  girlfriends wives quit jobs because it not worth it.  Just my opinion
author: Gary Lafferty

text: Excellent, Pete! By the way...do you know how to contact that beautiful nurse/caregiver? LOL.  Cheers!
author: Henry Mann

text: Ok I've been talking to a filipina myself. When I first started talking to her, the second thing she says is never send me anything I can take care of things myself. It rather surprised me. Yes she has loosened up and told me some rather disturbing things about her life but she assures me its the culture differences about how life styles are drastically different. Who am I to tell her otherwise. Only thing she asks is me to come there after the pandemic to meet her and her family. I have no problem with that however since I have never traveled to other countries im not sure what to expect. All I know its near tacloban city. All I'm concerned about is not making mistakes and being safe there. Not to mention hotels and such there. I've done research but can't find out much on the area. I guess ill just find out the hard way.
author: Kelly Taber

text: Absolutely the best information on helping your long distance relationship with your Filipina girlfriend. I am in a long distance relationship and I am financially quite well off and I don't mind helping my girlfriend. As long as you are happy with your long distance relationship and you feel strongly that you are not becoming an ATM then I see nothing wrong helping her financially.  How much monthly, depends on your income level and what you think is reasonable. You can't measure your happiness with few hundred  dollars if you are confident  of what you are doing. Oh! BTW, I have never been to Philippines and I am looking forward to meeting with my GF as soon as it's safe to do so. Cheers to all.
author: Harb Doad

text: There are many good reasons NOT to send money. And you've appropriately expounded on all of them. I am in agreement with you wholeheartedly. I am planning to visit the Philippines when the country opens. My Dad encouraged me to do that for many years prior to his passing. He was a pilot and stationed there in WWII. I also happen to be single (widower) and I would be open to developing a relationship. But I would certainly not do so out of desperation, as some men appear to do. But my comment is that perhaps the offer is made to see what type of reaction is generated. If there's been no previous talk of money, there's likely no immediate need for it either. And if, for example, she's hesitant or has declined the offer, then perhaps she's genuine and sincere, as you so often say that most Filipinas are. I apologize for the digression, but the comment may or may not have some merit. You are much wiser on the subject matter than me.
author: Thomas C

text: If I feel I'm in a serious relationship......(like I feel now) then I don't mind sending her money. It's like u said perfectly. "As long as u don't miss that money or you don't sent to where u couldn't afford it" other than that it doesn't affect me

Mainly for setting up a business for her family, so when she get over here to Australia, she won‚Äôt be worried about her family back in the Philippines.
author: Robert Wheeler

text: Send as much money as you can so she and her family can live okay. Most Filipinos can't even afford a refrigerator, washing machine or television, let alone a house, so even if you send her twenty thousand pesos, she still might not live as well as you considering she might have family including her parents to help support. Fresh food  is not cheap in the Philippines like even rice is around 40 pesos a kilo and a lot of fruit and vegetables are also around that price. I have seen apples at 40 pesos each apple and potatoes at 120 pesos per kilo, so the prices are similar to Australia. Actually appliances like refrigerators and washing machines seem to be more expensive than Australia. You can find out all this information from watching other Expats YouTube videos. Oh, if the relationship doesn't work out, just think of all the help you have given as charity knowing that you have helped Filipinos out of poverty at least for a while. ‚ò∫
author: Jason Guy

text: Eric, The amount one may send to a Filipina really depends on the amount of money you have and what her circumstance is. For example if I work a minimum wage job then finding $100 a month may be hard, but if I am a CEO of a company then I could easily give $500 a month and it wouldn't be missed. The main point here is don't take away from a Filipinas pride in herself to be independent and proud to be able to look after herself. Don't make her feel like a kept woman. If she has no job or a job that only pays a little then help accordingly within your budget so you don't end up broke yourself. As I say in the video 2500 - 4000 pesos will provide the bare necessities for her to get by and again you don't want to be fully subsidising her life.
author: All About Filipina Relationships

author: All About Filipina Relationships

text: MORE OFTEN THAN NOT.... your Filipina Girl will always be understanding  IF it comes to where you do have a problem giving her money... just be honest with her. Tell her that ...YOU... are undergoing $ stresses.   (The bias is a tendency to think that Americans / Westerners are "Rich".... and you are not "rich") (yet many Philippines people EASILY will blurt out, "you're American, you're RICH") ( ... educate them gently)   She will not understand the stresses that YOU live with     So.... if giving her money is a problem... Try to not let your ego be in the way of being OPEN & gentle with her about it.  Explain the "problem" or difficulty you are having, & do your best to remain patient... ALWAYS.  .................................... and then withdraw the funding or reduce it drastically... as you need  Remember TRY NOT TO LET ...your ego... DO THE TALKING IN YOUR HEAD do not feel "Guilty"   Be .......................... calm.  (even if she gets upset) ... this can be a GOOD "test" of your relationship. And it will also definitely TEST your own character.  IF... she is a "Good Girl" ... often SHE will actually begin to feel guilty, or like you are punishing her, if you withdraw funding............   She will DEFINITELY "wonder" what SHE DID to cause you to withdraw financial support.... so this can be prickly in many ways.   ...and if she actually DOES CARE about you?  ... she will not withdraw her "Care" ... for YOU She may suddenly begin talking a LOT lot more about how she can go out and make money now.   Remember, ... your OWN ego, may figure into how you react to ANY statements from her !  And this?  will more likely make YOU feel guilty that she is doing it.  Listening to her talk about working or trying to compensate for losing your $ support ................  It may play with your head, and make you ANGRY (because now YOU feel guilty) and you may with your Western thinking style .... begin to think that SHE is toying with you or saying it unaware that she is making YOU uncomfortable .....................she probably ~ is ~ making you uncomfortable if she says this. (and she is unaware of it) Keep a Grip on yourself  Long Distance Relationships  (LDR's) are not easy......  do not psyche YOURSELF OUT   and then undermine your own relationship with your own anger / insecure thoughts
author: AutomationDnD

text: if you want to stay in Ormoc overnite, I can recommend a nice place I stayed at near the Saban resort.
author: Dave Trotter

text: I have been to Tacloban in Jan of this year, and you don't have much to worry about.  I would land in Cebu, and take the fast ferry to Ormoc, then a van to Tacloban. you can easily find the van at the terminal, you can walk there from the ferry terminal, just turn left out of the gate, and walk towards the market.  I ended up going from Massin, by van, and it was okay, but the road is twisty and turny, and they stop half way there.  had to go and renew my visa.  it was a nice day trip since I had never been. take it from me, it's a piece of cake, if you need more info, just ask.
author: Dave Trotter

text: @Harb Doad  Thank you, glad you enjoy my videos and find good value in them. For sure, one needs to weigh the relationship up and also their own finances and decide what is reasonable. The Philippines is such an amazing Country and the people so friendly. You will enjoy that experience for sure when the time comes! Take care.
author: All About Filipina Relationships

text: My dad sent her money. I guess that when he ask her for her acct she did not hesitate and gv her not her own acct number but her so called sister's acct number. And when he already send and told her he's sending her RM1000 a month she even praised him saying how kind of him. Never met each other before. I suspect she's a scammer playing on his emotions and mentally. What u think?
author: MARY GOH

text: Certainly your Dad sounds like he was a wise man as the Philippines is an amazing Country. If one is looking for a loving relationship he can find it as can guys find a relationship based on things other then love. As I always say, A genuine Filipina is also a proud and independent woman so she certainly wont be asking or hinting for money. I remember in the early stages of my relationship I offered my Now wife a few hundred dollars to see what she if she was genuine and of course she rejected the offer telling me she was fine and has a job. I knew right then and there she was a good and genuine woman. Your comment is certainly welcome and has merit for sure.
author: All About Filipina Relationships

text: Good job Calvin! She's worth it!!
author: BOWN TOWN

text: Spot on Calvin! üëç
author: All About Filipina Relationships

text: it's EASY to get money from Western dudes.... they don't even have to "scam" Guys just GIVE... naturally
author: AutomationDnD

text: Any country where there is much poverty will have people looking to scam others especially around love scams. But these love scams are not high tech and easy to detect rather quickly if one knows what they're looking for.
author: All About Filipina Relationships

text: It not to much  if you can afford it make you happy don't listen to other 400$ a month not going to pay all her bills unless she has no rent  no children  or poor  parents who  need rice. of course they  do want to contribute but it dont make her dishonest or not genuine if she don't that ridiculous
author: Gary Lafferty

text: It's something I have been considering Rudolph and I have the paid version of streamyard to do live streams but there are also many downfalls to live streams. I haven't dismissed the idea all together but won't say right now that I will commit to it either.

author: All About Filipina Relationships

text: My girl is kind of giving up she don't think we're ever going to meet. she don't think the world's going to be the same for us to be able to meet. She don't think she's ever going to go back home to the Philippines that she's going to be stuck in Kuwait. I had planned to send her back to the Philippines where the new time something gets in the way where I cannot come up with the money to send her back.
author: Charles Ahlers

text: ¬†@Gary Lafferty¬† no for a year and a half she would argue with me about sending her money she always want to make sure me and my kids had money to take care of my bills for me to take care of my kids if I sent her money and I didn't send my kids money or my mom money should get mad she didn't want to take money away from them. But right now I'm not sending her much at all hardly because I've been unemployed a lot lately but she's still sticks with me but it's still not the same no she's having some trouble but she won't tell me what it is. I know she went and we knew her visa back in February and they still haven't given her a new Visa so right now she's in a country without a Visa. She's kind of a negative Filipina she's not the happy go lucky like most of the ones I've talked to. See you later we'll find out the truth on everything when the virus ever lets up and we all can get back to living our lives. Like me getting back to work make some money and go to the Philippines where they ever open up and see her. Then I'll know the truth.
author: Charles Ahlers

text: Maybe she mad cause you dont send her enough money they play mind games some time. Good luck
author: Gary Lafferty

text: Fingers crossed Charles. Hope all goes well.
author: All About Filipina Relationships

text: Well I will keep hanging in there see where it goes. I hope it works out I only do care about the woman only if I have been able to meet her in March like we had planned but we'll see where it ends up at
author: Charles Ahlers

text: Sorry to hear of your troubles Charles. Just a thought, It's rather common for Filipinas if they have problems going on in their life not to worry her man with those problems even though it's very obvious to the man and he may ask her "what's wrong" and she will say "nothing's wrong". Not sure if that could be part of what maybe happening or not? but as I say just a thought.  I wish you all the best Charles
author: All About Filipina Relationships

text: Hello, how are you doing my brother, on the subject, jes (sorry)yes i send my fiance money, this is why, besides her dear father (a wonderful man, i asked him for his daughter's hand and he said yes,and told me through tears,he's also a trike cab driver, that he's giving us our blessings üò¢üò¢üò¢üòìüòì)anyway, we have discussed the money situation and when i saw how she was living with& (sorry)with her father, brother, our kids,5 other family members..omg,one(sorry)several ocasions shes trying to sleep(a 5am wake up daily,cook,clean, clothes, everything by 7;00pm shes done period)so i said, what do you want to do about your living situation, she found a refurbished little house for a great amount of money monthly, so yah im making sure that shesconfortable especially the kids, she thaks me daily also, before I asked her about the ceromar,she asked me about the ceromar,and i said ill get it,we talk daily,every day,shes awesome and I absolutely can't wait until the Philippines opens back up, God bless you my brother and thank you soooooo much for your advice and information God bless you brother üôã‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüáµüá≠üá∫üá∏üéÖü§∂üéÑ
author: Edwin Kirkland

text: yeah married now and wife still stuck in the philippines due to come to UK soon. so obviously im sending living expenses. never sent her money when we werent married but did pay for philhealth,spectacles and some other things whilst there. i always remember that she and her family survived ok before i turned up.
author: John Gallant

text: That why there no cookie cutter approach on how much money to send .    i love you are only words my opinion it her action on money  what does she do with money?  The good one will tell you how she spends it  whether it 200$ or a 1000 USD  monthly
author: Gary Lafferty

text: Hi there ED, I am doing well thank you and hope you are as well? I certainly understand what you say around wanting her and the Family to be more comfortable, especially after seeing how they live. I did a similar thing after I met my Filipina in the Philippines after around 6 months. I saw how she was living which was so dangerous, I offered her and her sister help to move to a much safer apartment which made me feel much better as well and the help I offered was only 4000 a month because my wife and her sister both were working in Full time jobs. It worked out fine in the end as I am sure you guys will alsoüôÇüëç
author: All About Filipina Relationships

text: Hi John. It must be tough being married and apart right now. Hopefully you guys will be together soon. All the best mate.
author: All About Filipina Relationships
